text: [Music]
I'm Tyler I'm the lead site reliability
engineer here at peloton one thing is it
really is exciting for us is how
passionate our users are for the product
and for the bike and for the tread and
for everything else and so it's really
critical that it's available like if you
get up in the morning you want your bike
to be there for you and we view as an
extension of us being available for our
customers and being successful for our
members one of the really key challenges
for us is as we roll out new features
some of these things will like to cross
our platform many different ways and
then we have different types of impact
across various pieces of our API yeah I
think the fact that there's a hardware
component does make it like a very
unique challenge for us when you're
testing just on a local code machine or
developers doing local testing they
can't really simulate the real impact of
having many things happen as many events
have that scale and so what you'll see
is that like users will have like a
degraded experience like things may not
work you may see like slow response
times increased latency that like will
actually impact the user experience some
of the values of being able to scale
elastically is we're able to actually
the most simulate that experience and
also like see what happens when there is
a failure we can like the scale our
systems down and actually test to see if
those things would happen at different
levels it's very simple for us to
actually just go spin up in a duplicate
of our entire environment see what new
features would look like running there
at different types of scale at different
times a day and actually drive testing
traffic to that in isolation from our
other environments which has been really
critical for us and achieving success at
testing new features as well as testing
an entire integrated stack as a whole if
we didn't have Amazon Web Services it
would be very difficult for us to
actually do this testing if you're
trying to do this say in a data center
or just like locally you'd have to spend
a lot of time like manually managing
servers and resources that like you
could spend on your development time you
also have like it would be very
difficult to replicate some of the
development environments we have on
demand and so we spend a long time
actually managing those different
configuration
